thread.title: Kenyan opposition leader Odinga tells US to back off
thread.title_full: Kenyan opposition leader Odinga tells US to back off - StarTribune.com

posts.author: startribune.com
posts.title: Kenyan opposition leader Odinga tells US to back off
posts.text:
NAIROBI, Kenya — Kenya's opposition leader is rejecting U.S. advice to cancel a planned mock inauguration of him as president, saying he doesn't recognize the legitimacy of President Uhuru Kenyatta.
Raila Odinga alleged Thursday that dozens of Kenyans have been killed by the security forces and "nobody is talking about it. Yet they have the audacity to come and advise us to forget and move on."
He spoke outside a morgue in the capital Nairobi while accompanying families collecting bodies of the police's alleged victims.
A U.S. Embassy statement Wednesday called Odinga's planned protest event on Dec. 12 "extra-constitutional" and urged him to cancel the event.
Odinga successfully challenged Kenyatta's August re-election but then boycotted a rerun vote in October, demanding electoral reforms. Kenyatta was inaugurated last week.

thread.section_title: Welcome To MySayBook
thread.title: 'Pastor Adeboye is a thief, rogue, irresponsible, vile' - Gay activist bombs RCCG GO
thread.title_full: 'Pastor Adeboye is a thief, rogue, irresponsible, vile' - Gay activist bombs RCCG GO

posts.author: Boyfizzy (noreply@blogger.com)
posts.title: 'Pastor Adeboye is a thief, rogue, irresponsible, vile' - Gay activist bombs RCCG GO
posts.text:
This UK-based Nigerian gay activist has blasted the RCCG General Overseer, saying he is not only being a thief but irresponsible and vile.

Nigerian gay activist, Bisi Alimi has descended hard on Pastor Enoch Adeboye, the General Overseer of the Redeemed Christian Church of God [RCCG], calling the revered man of God a thief » , irresponsible and a vile man who steals from his congregation.

The United Kingdom-based gay man was reacting to Pastor Adeboye's statement at the opening of the RCCG Holy Ghost Congress at the Church's headquarters on December 4, 2017, where he said that anyone that buys a car with the money he did not earn lawfully would be riding in a moving coffin.

The statement was also posted on the verified Twitter handle of the RCCG GO but it did not sit well with Alimi, the first known Nigerian man to come out as gay and he also took to his verified account with the handle Ashiwaju Bisi Alimi@bisialimi to call out the man of God, saying Pastor Adeboye is not only a thief who steals from his members, but an irresponsible man and vile.

This is what Pastor Adeboye tweeted:
"If you buy a car with a money you didn’t earn lawfully you’ll be riding in a moving coffin."

Reacting to the statement, Alimi slammed Pastor ADeboye with his own series of tweets and called him so many names:



This is how he started: 
"This man is irresponsible and vile. He is the same man that buys private jets with stolen money and lay curses on his congregation if they fail to pay tithe."

"With this tweet, @PastorEAAdeboye assumes that his fraudulent ways of stealing money from his followers is somehow lawful, and hence his private jets are not flying coffins."

"According to @Forbes in March 2009, Pastor Adeboye spent $30 million on a Gulfstream jet amidst widespread criticism. Pastor Adeboye has no job apart from being a pastor. He is a rich pastor in a rich country » of poor people. See why he is a fraud?"

"According to same Forbes, his net worth is valued at between 39 to 65 million Dollars. That is $ and not N. Pastor Adeboye has no job apart from being a pastor; can we let that sink in?"

"@PastorEAAdeboye's income thrives on the corruption of the political class and the vulnerability of the poor in his church. This is the same man that asked for N1b donation in his church in a country with almost 40% unemployment rate."

"The moral of my tweets is that Adeboye's tweet was sent without him looking in the mirror and seeing that he is the thief and rogue, he is abusing in his tweet."

"It is either Pastor Adeboye is taking a piss on Nigerians or he doesn’t know he is a clown and I say this with so much respect for him and his fraudulent antics. #pastoradeboye #nigeria #419pastors #nigerianpastors."

Apart from attacking Pastor Adeboye on Twitter, Alimi also went to his Instagram page where he also painted the man of God as the devil incarnate himself who does not have any moral right to tell Nigerians not to steal.

"Why don’t we start today with the foolery of @pastor.adeboye? It seems the man has refused to look in the mirror and see this person flying in a coffin is him and his cohort of armed robbers who call themselves men of God!"

This is not the first time Bisi Alimi has attacked and insulted Pastor Adeboye and other men of God as he had, in the past, come out openly to call them names, claiming they are stealing money from the people and living like kings while their members have been living in abject poverty.

thread.title: Nigeria: Thousands Throng Redemption Camp for Holy Ghost Congress - allAfrica.com
thread.title_full: Nigeria: Thousands Throng Redemption Camp for Holy Ghost Congress - allAfrica.com

posts.title: Nigeria: Thousands Throng Redemption Camp for Holy Ghost Congress - allAfrica.com
posts.text:
A cross-section of worshippers at Redemption Camp of the Redeemed Christian Church of God By Isaactaiwo The 40th edition of the Holy Ghost Congress of the Redeemed Christian Church of God (RCCG) began on Monday at the Redemption Camp in Ogun State. With the theme: "Songs of Victory," worshippers from different parts of Nigeria, Africa and beyond, have been singing.The phenomenal event, which cbegan in 1977, and has been witnessing tremendous yearly increase.Adequate security arrangement had been put in place. Traffic has also been orderly. The church's traffic officers have ensured that the mammoth crowd, together with vehicles do not obstruct free-flow of traffic to other road users on the Lagos-Ibadan Expressway. Traders, who always hijack similar events, displayed their wares conspicuously to draw the attention of participants. This time, they were restricted to the areas they would not constitute nuisance to the worshippers. The church considers its theme fit for the event which also marks the 40th anniversary of the congress.The General Overseer of the Church, (Worldwide), Pastor Enoch Adejare Adeboye, described the congress, a special one. "From the theme: "Songs of Victory", you can be sure that God is about to do something in your life that will make you sing for joy all through this congress and beyond... ," Adeboye said. In his opening message entitled: "Victory Over Self", Adeboye underscored the importance of overcoming 'one self,' which is germane to anyone who wants to be great in life.He assured that victory could be achieved by those who gave their lives to Jesus. The Chairman, Christian Association of Nigeria (CAN), Apostle Alex Bamgbola, in his message entitled: "God Is A Spirit,", emphasised that only those born of the spirit could worship God in spirit and in truth. posts.title: Holiday Gift Guide: Wine Lovers
posts.text:
4 
This gift guide is also very personal to me (just like the cat lady gift guide from a few days ago) – this is the perfect gift guide for wine lovers! From t-shirts to wine glasses to socks letting people know just how much you like wine, this gift guide has got you covered! One // Two // Three // Four // Five // Six // Seven // Eight // Nine // Ten // Eleven 

The only alcoholic drink I like happens to be wine, and I know I am not the only one out there who loves a good glass of wine. Even as I write this post, I am currently sipping on some Frog’s Leap Chardonnay . I am pretty obsessed with this shirt from J. Crew since it lists pretty much all my favorite wines, but I also LOVE LOVE LOVE this shirt because it’s pretty much been my holiday hymn since the holiday season started. My stepmom got me these very appropriate socks as an early Christmas present that clearly explain me (she runs a wine bar in NoCal with my dad which makes them even more appropriate!). You also can’t go wrong with a cute wine glass , or a wine glass that can cure any bad day! 
For the wine lovers amongst your friends or family, these gag gifts would be perfect to gift them this holiday season!

posts.text: Finding The Best Animal Communication Services By Frank Fox Having a pet at home is quite wonderful. Even if you are living alone, you will never feel left out at all. At least, you could always have someone to talk to and play with. Humans are emotional being. Hence, it is important for their physical and mental health to have a company. They got to have some friends. They should have a family. Just imagine this. Every time you arrived at your apartment, even for the fact that you are living all by yourself, someone on your front door would greet you. As a human being, it is normal to feel lonely. This unique nature of yours is what makes you special and unique. Of course, some animals, like your pet, could feel the same way too. That is why try to help out each other. Strengthen your relationship. To keep them productive and jolly, you better let your pet visit the animal communication Colorado clinic. If possible, reconsider availing this service. This is important. Animals are living things. That only means that they are quite prone to illness too. Indeed, knowing that they are suffering, leaving the matter aside could be quite disastrous. If you really love something, it will be pretty shameful on your part to just ignore it. That is always provided. Therefore, make sure to always act kindly to your pet. Now, find someone who could support and evaluate their health. Depending on someone who lacks potential could be quite shameful. That actions of yours would only waste your time and even your efforts. You are not worthy of that treatment, though. Not even your pet. You know it. Hence, starting today, look for someone credible. There is no justice on that. Do not get the wrong idea. Nobody else in this world could protect your own interest and investment but you. Therefore, value your decisions. Take a look at the opportunities. Consider every prospect you have met and found. Every one of them holds a secret. Just try visiting their website. In this endeavor, money is not the only thing that is involved. The health of the animal, your efforts, and even your time, all of these would matter. Therefore, start to be more attentive. You could use the net to look or find a prospect. Just an advice, though, before you choose someone, inquire from your fellow owners. There are some blogs online that highly talks about these services. Usually, these blogs are created or hosted by renown animal organization or enthusiasts. You better hear out their advice. Nobody else is capable enough of helping you but those people that are highly involved in this particular field. You cannot just take advice from a novice. Talking with your fellow owners would help. Do not just accept the data that are posted online. Think about of reviewing your alternatives too. These animals serve as your family members. They are not just a nobody. That is why take care and value their presence. Getting their advice and recommendations might help. Speaking of recommendations, only speak with those people who have a very high standard. You should set your bars high. Speaking with less competent people would only produce less competent results. In short, the details you have collected will never have any value or interest. thread.title: Excellent private driver & English speaking tour guide - Phu Quoc Island
thread.title_full: Excellent private driver & English speaking tour guide - Phu Quoc Island Message Board - TripAdvisor

posts.author: Michael S
posts.title: Excellent private driver & English speaking tour guide - Phu Quoc Island
posts.text:
We had a long trip in Vietnam from the North to the South ( Hanoi , Sapa, Ha Long bay, Da Nang, Hoi An , Hue, Saigon, Mekong Delta and Phu Quoc island...), but now we are at our hometown with the snow, the freezing, with windy and rainy... to re-view and remembering our wonderful trip in Vietnam with sunshine, green landscapes and sunny beaches!.
It was a long trip crossing Vietnam with many interesting places and meeting lots of friendly Vietnamese peoples but most of them could not speak English, especially the driver in Vietnam, 99% of the drivers could not speak English (some drivers was annoyed when we ask them for a short trip or ask them waiting for us, maybe because they did not understand us), we would like to talk with them to explain but very difficult to understand each other.
At the end of the long trip, we stayed on Phu Quoc island for 3 days and we were lucky to meet a very good English speaking driver, he was a funny driver and very patient in waiting, he has a good car with good air-conditioned, very comfortable and very safety.
We went around the island with him, we also took a private boat trip with him to go fishing & snorkeling, he introduced to us a very good restaurant with local sea food, he explained to us everything about the island and we were surprised with his knowledge about all over Vietnam, he understands something more than some other tour guides in some places on the mainland of Vietnam.
He was very patient in waiting for us when we stay on the beach for swimming and having lunch (more than 2 hours), he drove very safety, he was a funny tour guide with some lovely stories... he was the best driver & tour guide in Vietnam we had ever, ever got, our trip on Phu Quoc island was definitely perfect!
We spend our time to post a review for him on TripAdvisor because he told me he had 3 kids need to take care (two daughters and one boy is going to be born in December 2017) and because he gave us a very, very wonderful trip around Phu Quoc island so we would like to help him to connect with some other potential customers on the Internet to help him has more clients and earns some more moneys for his wife and his children, to help his family a better life.
I am not sure if you could reach this review or not, but if you see this post and want to have his contact information to book a private trip for you in the future, you could send a private message to me in this post or by TripAdvisor message, I will send back to you his detail information as soon as possible whenever I have free time!.
2 destinations mentioned in this post 1 Hanoi Vietnam 2 Hoi An Quang Nam Province, Vietnam See all 2

By Jashima Wadehra 
I am ALL about the wellness train that defined 2017. I am not, however, the most well-versed on spending hours peeling, chopping and blending my nutrients into instagram- worthy mason jar smoothies. I used to be a start-my-morning-with-a-cup-of-coffee kind of girl, until I discovered my morning elixir 3 months ago, life hasn’t been the same. 
ContinueIn an effort to assist de-bloating and promote a sunnier disposition I decided to incorporate the tried and true warm lemon water into my morning routine, which was great but it got me thinking…..I had heard A LOT about the benefits of unadulterated Apple Cider Vinegar and wanted to experience it for myself while integrating a few other key ingredients. 
Say Hello to your new favorite hair, skin and energy life hack:I compile the following ingredients in my trusty 32.oz water tumbler:

thread.title_full: Are night/sleeper busses really that bad? - Vietnam Message Board - TripAdvisor

posts.author: ross m
posts.text:
I did 10 hours on a trip that I was told would be a max of 8. The driver was not the worst but he was still scary and drivers of other trucks and buses were worse.
The sleeper buses are death traps. The maze of framework to contain 3 rows of upper and lower bunks prohibits fast evacuation.
If the bus goes into deep water or catches fire you are finished.
Have a look on google images for "VIETNAMESE BUS CRASHES" Note they are nearly all head on smashes?
We went with a company that was supposed to be the best. After we left the bus station we stopped 15 mins later to pick up another 20 passengers who did not get a ticket and had to sit on the floor so the police would not see them.
So now we were on an overloaded bus that was difficult enough to exit when it had its normal number of passengers.
I would gladly pay more for a decent bus with staff and management who provided a honest service.
Edited: 04 December 2017, 14:12

Went from Hanoi to Cao Bang a couple weeks ago. I made the mistake of requesting a seat with the most leg room (sort of jokingly)... So I was put in the back row. At first I thought it was great because it was very spacious. But the road was very windy and bumpy, so I was bouncing around for 8 hours and couldn't sleep. Can't comment on how safely it was driven because I couldn't see anything from the back of the bus (maybe a good thing). The bus itself was very nice though there was no washroom (probably just as well).
I did enjoy being the only foreigner on the bus though!!

posts.author: Travelphil89
posts.title: Are night/sleeper busses really that bad? - Vietnam
posts.text:
Hi!
I now read many stories about "horrible" bus trips. And in every thread people are recommending to avoid a night bus at every cost!
But I'm wondering a little bit. Some complaints are about non-working Wifi, staff not speaking English, no power sockets, etc.
Are there really people who expect same standards like in Europe/USA on their bus trips?
I'm not expecting these things. I took many night busses in Thailand and Myanmar (Burma). Experienced non-english-speaking staff, freezing cold temperatures inside, loading people up on the road, etc.
For sure there are other complaints. About dropping people of in the wrong cities (scam to let them take another hotel or taxi). People having to sleep on the floor between the beds. I never experienced these things on my night bus trips.
So is it really much worse in Vietnam than in Thailand or Myanmar?
Thanks and have a nice evening.
2 destinations mentioned in this post 1 Thailand 2 Myanmar See all 2

Putting the facilities and bus conditions aside it is safety that concerns most of us. Long journeys in the dark with drivers who are known to take drugs to stay awake. The train is better, flying even better still.

thread.title_full: Additional 275 Edo indigenes arrive Benin from Libya

posts.author: Admin2 SundiataPost
posts.title: Additional 275 Edo indigenes arrive Benin from Libya
posts.text:
Additional 275 Edo indigenes arrive Benin from Libya December 7, 2017 
Benin – No fewer than 275 Edo indigenes on Wednesday voluntarily arrived Benin from Libya with the help of the state government. 
The Edo Attorney General and commissioner for Justice, Yinka Omorogbe told newsmen in Benin that out of the number 58 were girls, 2 infants and 215 boys. 
Omorogbe, who is also the chairman of the Edo state task force on human trafficking, said they have received about 1,100 Edo indigenes from Libya between November and December. 
She explained that rehabilitation process has commenced through giving them an on-the-spot medical attention to assess the level of their fitness. 
She said: ”this is the seventh batch that we have so far received. We are going to keep them in the hotel for two nights after which we will reunite them with their families. 
”Government has set up a programme to train them in different skills, and those who wish to return to school will be assisted to do so. In addition, government is also paying them monthly stipends for three months.” 
According to the Attorney General, the problem of illegal migration is an international problem, adding that the state government would continue to rehabilitate those who voluntarily return home. 
”A state drafted bill against trafficking in person is currently before the state house of assembly for consideration and passage.” 
Omorogbe, however, noted that more Edo indigenes were expected in Benin on Friday.

I have no intention to 100% complete this game (Korok Seeds, really? ), and I've only used guides for one or two smaller things (when does the Gerudo in the Goron City change which gem she wants to buy? Oh, shes stuck buying diamonds? Okay.), but I have had a GREAT time swapping strategies and hints with friends. Just tonight my friend and I finally tackled one side quest that has had us both scratching our heads for a while now. Hot Gossip is the new Strategy Guide.
Early on in the game I was disappointed that so many sidequests only gave Rupees. I had some weird flashbacks to Twilight Princess where I was just wandering around with Rupees, but I never bothered to get the Rupee Armor so it was all useless, and I went through numerous dungeons littered with "unopened" Rupee Chests. But in BOTW, between purchasing certain armor sets, keeping my arrows supplied, and other expenses...and then considering that rupees aren't as preposterously abundant in this game as they are in other Zelda games (at least, in proportion to what they expect you to spend)...it's actually really nice.

I understand that a lot of people don't mind guides, but leaning on them too much as I play bothers me a lot. I was pretty annoyed at myself using a shrine map to find the last dozen-ish shrines (and even then, simply knowing where a shrine is located is often only a small piece of a larger puzzle).
Personally, I just really hate the overall concept of having over a dozen "levels" of a game and being forced to start over from the beginning when you fail. I was very happy to see that concept mostly died off since it was originally an artificial way to increase the length of the short games that were common in the 8-16 bit era.
I'm satisfied with my time playing the game even if I never truly complete it. Just like the dozens of games I've beaten on PS4 that I will never get a platinum trophy for.

thread.section_title: Games and Technology — Penny Arcade
thread.title: [Zelda: Breath of the Wild] Master Trials DLC out now - The Champions' Ballad late 2017 38
thread.title_full: [Zelda: Breath of the Wild] Master Trials DLC out now - The Champions' Ballad late 2017 - Page 38 — Penny Arcade

posts.author: Terrendos
posts.text:
Quote: : » So 9 months later, and I finally got around to wrapping up the last of the Shrines. Sadly, I will never truly complete this game. I really have no intention of suffering through the Trial of the Sword. I could only suffer such tedium back when I was a kid who only got 2 or 3 games a year. Of course, knowing that I will never finish that side quest kind of killed any desire I had to finish the rest of the side quests. Why bother when it'll never be 100%?
That said, looking forward to the final DLC, whenever that gets released.
As much as I've really enjoyed this game, I'm a little worried the massive scope of it will hurt it's replay value. I have about zero interest tracking down all those shrines again, or grinding resources to upgrade armor. The other option is to just beeline to the 4 Beasts and Ganon, but I wonder how a casual gamer like myself would fare with that amount of difficulty (heading into the endgame with hardly any heart containers and shit equipment).
You should be able to pick up the Master Sword at least, even if you just hit up the fun/useful shrines, and the Hyrulian garb is easy enough to max out without any real grinding. Just pick up a good supply of Durians before you head for the castle and you should be fine.

thread.section_title: World
thread.title: German Social Democrats mull talks on new Merkel government
thread.title_full: German Social Democrats mull talks on new Merkel government - StarTribune.com

posts.author: startribune.com
posts.title: German Social Democrats mull talks on new Merkel government
posts.text:
BERLIN — Germany's center-left Social Democrats are discussing whether to open talks with Chancellor Angela Merkel's conservatives on extending their governing coalition, or at least backing a minority government.
The Social Democrats' leadership insisted the party would go into opposition after a disastrous election result in September. It reinforced its refusal to join a new coalition after Merkel's talks with two smaller parties collapsed last month.
However, President Frank-Walter Steinmeier made clear that he doesn't want a new election, and Social Democrat leader Martin Schulz reversed course.
At a previously scheduled party congress Thursday, Schulz is seeking members' approval for a resolution approving talks on "whether and in what form" the Social Democrats can support a new government. But some members want to specifically rule out another coalition.

thread.title_full: Vetting Your Vehicle Insurance Company And Conserving Loan

posts.author: asiajoke92celine
posts.title: Vetting Your Vehicle Insurance Company And Conserving Loan
posts.text:
Getting the best automobile insurance rate is simply a matter of knowing the facts about insurance plans. This article will give you a variety of tips on what to look out for when you’re reading to purchase a policy. Applying these tips should help you save money on your premium, no matter what type of car or truck you drive.
When shopping for Click At this website on auto insurance, do not inflate the worth of your vehicle. Claiming your vehicle to be worth more than it is will only increase the cost of your premiums. In the case of a total loss accident, you will only be paid the amount your vehicle was actually worth at the time of the damage.
One way to save money on your auto insurance is to buy your policy over the internet. Purchasing your policy online incurs fewer costs for the insurance company and many companies will then pass on those savings to the consumer. Buying auto insurance online can save you about five to ten percent annually.
When shopping for an auto insurance policy, most companies are going to offer extras like towing, road-side assistance, GPS services, and other add-ons. These may come in handy if you’re ever in a pinch, but they can be really expensive. Say no to these extras in order to save money on your insurance.
When you rent a car, you will likely be asked if you want to purchase coverage for the vehicle. Before http://markets.pentictonherald.ca/pentictonherald/news/read/35356354 answer, you should know whether or not your personal automobile insurance covers rental cars. If it does, how much is covered? Ask your agent, or read your policy to be clear.
As an automobile insurance customer, you should always be on the lookout for scams out there. With new insurance companies popping up every day, some of them make bold statements and promise to offer lower monthly premiums, but the coverage is cut-rate at best and is likely to drastically increase after you file a claim.
If you’re searching for lower rates, you might want to consider driving less. Simply put, if you drive less, your chances of an accident decrease. just click the following article have low-mileage discounts for people that have a short commute or drive only a few miles a year. Ask your insurance company and see if you can receive that discount.
Mistakes do happen! Check your driving record with the Department of Motor Vehicles – before you get an auto insurance quote! Make sure your driving record is accurate! You do not want to pay a premium higher than you have to – based on someone else who got into trouble with a license number similar to your own! Take the time to make sure it is all correct!
To save money on your insurance you should remove rental car coverage. This is an extra that isn’t absolutely necessary and costs you more to have on your insurance. You can save more money per year by removing this coverage and pay out of pocket if you need to rent a vehicle.
Be aware of everything you are insuring. A lot of people have car insurance but surprisingly few actually look at the individual things they are insuring. It is important to know your insurance types. You don’t want to get in a wreck and find something expensive wasn’t covered by your insurance.
Everyone knows that a Ferrari is an expensive car, but what you may not know is that the insurance will be vastly more expensive as well. If you have your heart set on a car like this, make sure that you consider the increased prices of the insurance as well. At times it can be as much as 3 times the price of a normal car.
Call your insurance company before you go to buy a new car. Auto insurance can be a huge expense when you are making payments on a car. Leasing a car often has high insurance rates as well. Know what to expect before you buy, and you will have an easier time budgeting.
If you are having a difficult time paying for your car insurance when it is due, you should ask the company for an extension on the due date. Some insurance companies are willing to work with their customers during hard financial times. They may allow you to take an extra month to make the payment.

Pay your premiums in full! This is one of the best ways to instantly get a discount from most insurance companies. Instead of paying your premiums over 6 months or even a year, if you have the money to pay everything immediately, you will most likely get a noticeable discount.
If you get into a car crash or other accident, it is too late to use insurance to cover costs to repair your vehicle. To avoid the illegal practice of driving without insurance, check out multiple policies and pick one you can afford. Remember these tips when looking for auto insurance.

thread.section_title: Technology Org
thread.title: Study finds drones more damaging than bird strikes to planes
thread.title_full: Study finds drones more damaging than bird strikes to planes

posts.author: Jovita
posts.title: Study finds drones more damaging than bird strikes to planes
posts.text:
Study finds drones more damaging than bird strikes to planes Posted Yesterday 
As part of a multi-institution Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) study focused on unmanned aerial systems, researchers at The Ohio State University are helping quantify the dangers associated with drones sharing airspace with planes. 
Last week, a research team from the Alliance for System Safety of UAS through Research Excellence (ASSURE) released a report concluding that drone collisions with large manned aircraft can cause more structural damage than birds of the same weight for a given impact speed. Computer simulation of a drone-aircraft collision. Image credit: Assure. 
The FAA will use the research results to help develop operational and collision risk mitigation requirements for drones. ASSURE conducted its research with two different types of drones on two types of aircraft through computer modeling and physical validation testing. 
Kiran D’Souza , assistant professor of mechanical and aerospace engineering at Ohio State, led the engine ingestion portion of the first-of-its-kind study. 
“Even small unmanned aircraft systems can do significant damage to engines,” D’Souza said. 
Reports of close calls between drones and airliners have surged. The FAA gets more than 100 sightings a month of drones posing potential risks to planes, such as operating too close to airports. The FAA estimates that 2.3 million drones will be bought for recreational use this year, and the number is expected to rise in coming years. 
Unlike the soft mass and tissue of birds, drones typically are made of more rigid materials. The testing showed that the stiffest components of the drone—such as the motor, battery and payload—can cause the most damage to the aircraft body and engine. 
Led by Gerardo Olivares, director of Wichita State University ’s National Institute for Aviation Research , the team evaluated the potential impacts of drones weighing 2.7 to 8 pounds on a single-aisle commercial transport jet and a business jet. 
They examined collisions with the wing leading edge, the windshield, and the vertical and horizontal stabilizers. The windshields generally sustained the least damage and the horizontal stabilizers suffered the most serious damage. The severity levels ranged from no damage to failure of the primary structure and penetration of the drone into the airframe. 
An expert in gas turbine dynamics, Ohio State’s D’Souza conducted computer simulations to evaluate the potential damage of a drone entering a generic mid-sized business jet engine, including damage to fan blades, the nacelle and the nosecone. 
The simulations revealed that the greatest damage and risk occurs during takeoff, since the fan is operating at the highest speed at this phase of flight. The location of the drone’s contact on the fan is a key parameter, with the most damage occurring when the impact is near the blade tip. 
According to D’Souza, the next step is the development of a representative commercial jet engine model for ingestion simulations, as well as full-scale testing to verify and validate the simulations. The team is planning additional research on engine ingestion in collaboration with engine manufacturers, as well as additional airborne collision studies with helicopters and general aviation aircraft. 
The researchers concluded that drone manufacturers should adopt “detect and avoid” or “geo-fencing” capabilities to reduce the probability of collisions with other aircraft. 
Led by Mississippi State University, ASSURE was established as the FAA UAS Center of Excellence in 2015. It comprises 23 of the world’s leading research institutions and more than 100 leading industry/government partners. ASSURE members are core to three FAA UAS test sites, lead four FAA research centers, and have seven airfields and a 340 UAS fleet.

thread.section_title: World
thread.title: Dozens of Ugandan troops to be withdrawn from Somalia duty
thread.title_full: Dozens of Ugandan troops to be withdrawn from Somalia duty - StarTribune.com

posts.author: startribune.com
posts.title: Dozens of Ugandan troops to be withdrawn from Somalia duty
posts.text:
KAMPALA, Uganda — Uganda's military says it has begun withdrawing dozens of its troops from peacekeeping duty in Somalia.
Lt. Col. Deo Akiiki, deputy spokesman for the Ugandan military, said Thursday that 281 troops will leave Somalia by Dec. 31.
Akiiki said that under an agreement between the African Union and the U.N. Security Council the number of all African peacekeepers in Somalia will be reduced by 1,000 before the end of 2017.
Uganda has over 6,000 troops deployed in Somalia as part of the multi-national African Union force. Other African countries such as Burundi and Kenya also contribute to the regional force.
The Western-backed deployments have helped to push Islamic extremists out of Somalia's capital and other centers, even though the rebels still make frequent bombing attacks targeting public places.

posts.text:
Jeff Kent said: ↑ The other day a co-worker asked me if I like The Red Hot Chili Peppers. I said I'd seen them a few times in the early 90s, but had lost interest. She mentioned they were playing a local theater and tickets were $24. That sounded like a good deal to her, so she bought a pair. Turns out it was The Red Hot Chili PIPERS. I checked out their site and frankly, I'd rather see them than Flea and Co.
Red Hot Chilli Pipers Click to expand... There is a Red Hot Chili Peppers tribute band making the rounds called "The Red Not Chili Peppers."
